title: The life of Joseph Hodges Choate as gathered chiefly from his letters,
author: Choate, Joseph Hodges
snippet: Only there is a disposition everywhere to see and exhibit an Ambassador and so I was kept going. Sir William Muir, the head of the College,  entertained me most hospitably at Dean Park House, and his daughter, Mrs. Arbuthnot was most charming. She is the sister of Genl.
